name: EVIII
title: Good merchant Terrible platform
text: Had nothing but a good experience from the merchant who sold this.Xbox as a platform is terrible though. Xbox has long been the multiplayer focused platform yet because of design flaws in the system and its always on (but we pretend like its not) requirement when instances of big games being released (like the recent Gears 5) or general server outages it renders the console useless if you cannot "call home" to verify your fealty to Microsoft. You have to have already put your machine into offline mode in order to have avoided this which is mostly impossible to predict when it will happen and is simply not possible after the fact of a server outage. Whats worse is you virtually MUST keep it online.Further the system is built around digital distribution from the ground up.  Focus on multiplayer games to sell Xbox live, Games with gold and their psuedo netflix style Game Pass service offer the promise of delivering you games. Yet you own nothing. You only get privilege to access these things so long as you have paid your tithe to Microsoft. Stop paying your subscription fees and those "free" games you were given with gold are locked out and inaccessible to you until you DO pay. That keeps you paying, and agreeing to waive more and more of your legal rights each time they feel compelled to take more from you, which 95% of gamers have no clue what they are taking because they just blindly scroll through the terms and conditions just to get to the agree box.Then their gamepass service IS COMPLETELY online required. Despite having a game installed and a valid subscription to it, AND the capacity to run clocks underneath the software that will know when to cut off your access once your subscription cuts off despite not having a connection, you cannot access ANY game pass games offline in any capacity.Everybody talks about it does not have games. That obviously is not true. It has most the same games you would get on PS4 and to a lesser extent Switch. The games where it lacks is exclusives, but technically that is not true. It does have some exclusives, but like with everything else with the console they are hidden and locked away behind digital distribution. When you count how many physical exclusives they have you can just about count them on two hands.The Xbox embodies all the worst traits of gaming this generation. Pointless style over substance (as seen between standard and X model of console that has next to no justification to exist because no games fully utilize its added horsepower)  Demanding you swear fealty and give your rights away in perpetuity, trading money for nothing but revocable licenses, forced online need, focus on multiplayer digital sport type experiences instead of on video games, everything about the platform is bad. Its taking the worst practices in the industry and distilling them to an anti consumer driven digital sports focused machine that is more than happy to take your money but expects you to keep handing it over after any transaction has been completed.While the PS4 (PRO ONLY) and Switch have some similar elements, Microsofts anti consumer products are the only field where they are actually innovating. So do not make the mistake I made and hurt the industry by buying this garbage.I give the merchant 5/5 and Microsoft NEGATIVE 5 out of 5 because it should not even exist in this state, to the point that one day in the future it will require legislation to fix the things they are trying to do with this and future incarnations of the Xbox platform.

name: Zero One
title: Broken Console by an Indifferent Vendor
text: XBox One S is the worst console I have every owned. Laggy, buggy, prone to crashes due to three clunky OS (master, entertainment, gaming). I performed two full factory resets out of the box, four partial factory resets and it ultimately died during the seventh. I played a single game on it and watched a few movies. Sneeze at it: crash. Look at it: crash. Not to mention it is not the momentous improvement as billed over the original model, let alone my tried and true 360. I never regretted buying a 360. It worked. Sure it sounds like a horror movie lawnmower but that's what TV volume buttons are for, right?The One S ensures that all gaming is a scheduled event. Download the game, even the 360 game an emulator runs, reload it 2x so the install completes. Download all the patches that are required. Five hours later, time to play! "Sorry, something went wrong." That's an actual error message.If you don't have immediate problems you can wait for trust Microsoft to mess up an update with bugs. They want your machine on all the time so they can crash it before you can sneeze in the machine's direction. Customer support? Check the forum. Look at the forum. Call customer support! It would be more hilarious if I hadn't wasted nearly $300 and 20+ hours of maintenance time. I have maybe an hour a week to game and this console doesn't allow for pickup and play. Rather, you escape into an ecosystem of ambivalence and frustration, where you are leasing "beta"-level hardware. Then you get weekly updates on all the fun games you don't get to play.

I have had my xbox for one year with 7 games on it and last week I started getting error messages. I called up the help line and the xbox guy literally said my xbox one was trash. They refused to fix it because apparently they don't fix my version of the xbox one anymore. (I'd be way more understanding if I had a faulty xbox360!- I'd be bummed but i wouldn't be warning people away.)So not wanting to waste all the games I bought and needing a system for streaming apps I found an xbox one s in relatively good shape and I bought that. Plus my best friend has an xbox one s (my fault) so I'm trapped until next gen.Right at this moment I can't even sign into my account due to actual xbox live issues. It has been an hour.My boyfriend has a ps4 and uses it SO much more than I use my system, and has NONE of these issues. None. This boy never even shuts his ps4 down the safe way.Don't make the same mistake I did. My ps2 still works and that should have been the life experience I needed to stick with ps consoles. Just buy a ps4. Don't risk such a huge investment in a system that has these issues.

name: Kyle Ebel
title: Efficient and Easy on the Wallet
text: The Xbox 1S is a good console if your looking for an upgrade for the Xbox 1, but don’t have a lot of money. This would be great for Parents and College students who might want to buy an Xbox, for multiple of purposes. It can also be used for beginner streamers. It gives you a good base to start with and comes with good games like Gears of War, Halo series, Cup Heads, etc.Somethings that you might want to know+Is always on, even when you have it off.+I had one incident of miss coloring, but a hard reset fixed it.+It is very customizable, and have a bunch of options for you to mess with.+The voice activation function is very annoying, can turn it off.+No more energy box, just the power cordYou can use twitch, but Xbox has bought it’s own streaming site.If you like Xbox, but just can’t afford the Xbox X this is for you. It has good graphics, and comes with all the things you need to connect it with a TV with an hdmi cable. As like every xbox it can be a good dvd player, netflix device and a casual gaming console. If you are looking for streaming or recording purposes, the console comes with a built in system giving you the ability to stream, and also it comes with inputs in order to capture content. The Xbox 1s comes with 1080p streaming capabilities, you just need the Internet to support it.  I recommend it to anyone looking into this.
